text.p: SofTech Inc said it completed the acquisition of Computer Graphics Corp, an Indianapolis-based company, in exchange for 405,000 shares of SofTech stock.
The purchase agreement provides for the issuance of up to 210,000 additional shares based on attainment of certain profitability goals for the 12-month period ended December 31, 1997.

Computer Graphics, which provides engineering services related to the mechanical CAD/CAM marketplace, had revenue of about $1.8 million in 1996. Computer Graphics has been historically profitable, SofTech said.

Separately, SofTech said it hired Calvin Gee as the manager of its high-end consulting and services business for the Southwest region of the United States. Since 1994, Gee has been a sole proprietor of a mechanical CAD/CAM, high-end consulting and services business located in Austin, Texas.

His business, Mechanical Design Synthesis Consulting, generated about $700,000 of services-only revenue. Rather than acquire the business, SofTech offered Gee a compensation package that includes 150,000 stock options that vest over the next three years, it added.
